revised_title: Investigation of Effective Valency of Transition Metals in Solid Solution
tldr: The authors studied the lattice spacing relationships in the close-packed hexagonal phases of alloys containing copper, germanium, and transition metals (manganese, iron, cobalt, and nickel). They found that the effective valency of the transition metals in the alloys varies depending on the electron-to-atom ratio and the type of transition metal. The results provide insights into the electronic properties of alloys and the behavior of transition metals in solid solutions.
